DOC.brief_summary: The main purpose of this study is to assess the concentration of elemental impurities in blood and urine after chronic administration of Smecta® in subjects with chronic functional diarrhoea. For exploratory purposes, the potential effects of diosmectite on bowel microbiote composition will be investigated.
DOC.brief_title: Chronic Administration of Diosmectite (SMECTA®) in Subjects With Chronic Diarrhoea
DOC.criteria: Male or female subjects, between 18 and 60 years old inclusive, BMI between 19 and 32 kg/m2 inclusive (minimum body weight of 50 kg at screening). Functional chronic diarrhoea defined as loose or watery stools occurring in at least 75% of stools for the last 3 months (with symptom onset at least 6 months before diagnosis). No history of suspected organic or drug induced cause to chronic diarrhoea.
